newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albanian gunmen spray bus with bullets, kill one.
newsitem.headline: Albanian gunmen spray bus with bullets, kill one.

text.p: Albanian gunmen sprayed a public bus with bullets on Wednesday, killing one passenger and wounding seven others just south of the capital Tirana, an interior ministry source said.

In one of the worst incidents in the wave of violence which has swept the Balkan country, the gunmen overtook the bus in a four-wheel drive vehicle and then opened fire. A child was in critical condition in hospital, the source said.

Albania has been engulfed by turmoil since January, when a series of fraudulent investment schemes collapsed, igniting furious protests by ruined depositors. Most of the south has since been taken over by rebels in an armed insurrection.
But the kind of lawlessness by armed gangs which has reigned in the south has been rare in the capital itself, where police and the army are still in control.

The incident took place near the village of Sauk, just south of Tirana and about one hour before an evening curfew which was imposed with a state of emergency early this month. The gunmen fled and the motive for the shooting was unknown.
